## Alias Queries

### alias {#a5c70adc73969ef8175ad49c101291cb4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>AliasResult AAResults::alias (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp; LocA, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp; LocB)</>}>
The main low level interface to the alias analysis implementation.

Returns an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult">AliasResult</a> indicating whether the two pointers are aliased to each other. This is the interface that must be implemented by specific alias analysis implementations.

### doesNotAccessMemory {#a4330af78f333c52e594aa71baa274bd1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::AAResults::doesNotAccessMemory (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; Call)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Checks if the specified call is known to never read or write memory.

Note that if the call only reads from known-constant memory, it is also legal to return true. Also, calls that unwind the stack are legal for this predicate.

Many optimizations (such as CSE and LICM) can be performed on such calls without worrying about aliasing properties, and many calls have this property (e.g. calls to &#39;sin&#39; and &#39;cos&#39;).

This property corresponds to the GCC &#39;const&#39; attribute.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h/#l00453">453</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### doesNotAccessMemory {#a3a92463610cec77938dacc8eecbc3ee4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::AAResults::doesNotAccessMemory (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42; F)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Checks if the specified function is known to never read or write memory.

Note that if the function only reads from known-constant memory, it is also legal to return true. Also, function that unwind the stack are legal for this predicate.

Many optimizations (such as CSE and LICM) can be performed on such calls to such functions without worrying about aliasing properties, and many functions have this property (e.g. &#39;sin&#39; and &#39;cos&#39;).

This property corresponds to the GCC &#39;const&#39; attribute.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h/#l00468">468</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getArgModRefInfo {#abf2edcff5abc0b60c6eb6a3f66dfcc33}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ModRefInfo AAResults::getArgModRefInfo (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; Call, unsigned ArgIdx)</>}>
Get the ModRef info associated with a pointer argument of a call.

The result&#39;s bits are set to indicate the allowed aliasing ModRef kinds. Note that these bits do not necessarily account for the overall behavior of the function, but rather only provide additional per-argument information.

### getMemoryEffects {#a98f54e18da022cdb497fbbeed4488276}

<MemberDefinition

### getModRefInfo {#a2205e49ace8bb2fd9934342ff6a25e13}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ModRefInfo llvm::AAResults::getModRefInfo (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &gt; &amp; OptLoc)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> whether or not an instruction may read or write the optionally specified memory location.

An instruction that doesn&#39;t read or write memory may be trivially LICM&#39;d for example.

For function calls, this delegates to the alias-analysis specific call-site mod-ref behavior queries. Otherwise it delegates to the specific helpers above.

### getModRefInfoMask {#a7785e563bd969eb1f63d26eca6873eb6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ModRefInfo AAResults::getModRefInfoMask (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp; Loc, bool IgnoreLocals=false)</>}>
Returns a bitmask that should be unconditionally applied to the ModRef info of a memory location.

This allows us to eliminate Mod and/or Ref from the ModRef info based on the knowledge that the memory location points to constant and/or locally-invariant memory.

If IgnoreLocals is true, then this method returns NoModRef for memory that points to a local alloca.

### onlyReadsMemory {#acc08d3794eb34598ea9f389c9b7f51d1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::AAResults::onlyReadsMemory (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42; Call)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Checks if the specified call is known to only read from non-volatile memory (or not access memory at all).

Calls that unwind the stack are legal for this predicate.

This property allows many common optimizations to be performed in the absence of interfering store instructions, such as CSE of strlen calls.

This property corresponds to the GCC &#39;pure&#39; attribute.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h/#l00481">481</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Functions that unwind the stack are legal for this predicate.

This property allows many common optimizations to be performed in the absence of interfering store instructions, such as CSE of strlen calls.
